chapter.title: Dashboard
chapter.para: The CSC Dashboard is a page that provides you the current status of @@ProductName@@ at a glance.
The following figure shows the CSC Dashboard:

formalpara.para:
On CSC startup, the Line State Diagnosis is run and the results are displayed in this area of the dashboard. The Overall Health Check area on the dashboard displays the following:
DSL Connection Status: When LSD is run on startup, the DSL Line Status is displayed in this area. The current status of LSD is displayed whenever the Dashboard is updated.
NAF Connection Status
DSL QoS Test: The QoS is computed is displayed in this area.
The following information of the subscriber's DSL line is displayed:
Status of the line, Up, Down, and Unknown.
Quality of service indicator, Bad, Medium, Good, and Unknown.
NAF Quality of Service

formalpara.title: Detected Issues
formalpara.para: On CSC startup, any issues that are detected when the LSD is run and the recomended troubleshooting steps are displayed in this area of the dashboard. The detected issues are shown even if the DSL line is not sychronized.

formalpara.title: Detected issues by QoS

para.emphasis: To describe about the defected issues by QoS

formalpara.para: QoS stands for quality of service. The quality can be either good, bad, marginal, or unknown based on what the getOpticalLinkHistoricalServiceImpact API returns as shown below.

listitem.para: First, QoS calls the getActiveFaultsOnBranch. If any fault is found, it populates one field that indicates the problem in this line (it is viewed only in the Account Activity tab).
Secondly, it calls getOpticalLinkParameters to check if ONT is up or down. The details can be viewed in Account Activity.

formalpara.title: Detected issues by connection status
formalpara.para:
The connection status shows any faults that are present by calling getActiveFaultsOnBranch. The table below lists the faults shown in CSC. Faults

formalpara.title: Account Information
formalpara.para: The DSL Services subscriber account information is displayed in this area of the dashboard.

formalpara.title: Troubleshooting
formalpara.para: The workflows that can be run for troubleshooting are displayed in this area of the dashboard.

listitem.para: A basic troubleshooting workflow that quickly checks whether there is an obvious DSL disconnect or quality issue that is impacting subscriber service.

Complex workflows to troubleshoot the issues,where:
There is no DSL Connection.
The DSL Connection is slow.
The DSL Connection is frequently interrupted.

formalpara.para:
To run DSLST workflow
In the Troubleshooting area on the dashboard, click DSL Line.
The following troubleshooting conditions are displayed:
There is no DSL connection
The DSL connection is slow
The DSL connection is frequently interrupted
DSL status
Select the troubleshooting condition.
The DSLST Workflow runs based on the selection.
